alert.note: Alert for Cibola; McKinley; Rio Arriba; San Juan; Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 22 at 11:21AM MST until February 22 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Central Cibola County in west central New Mexico... Eastern McKinley County in west central New Mexico... Northwestern Rio Arriba County in north central New Mexico... Northwestern Sandoval County in north central New Mexico... Southeastern San Juan County in northwestern New Mexico... * Until noon MST. * At 1120 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 9 miles northwest of Heron Lake State Park to near El Morro, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 53 and 92. Highway 550 between Mile Markers 73 and 107. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 108 and 126. Locations impacted include... Grants, Milan, Thoreau, Counselor, Bluewater Lake State Park, El Morro, El Vado, Bluewater Lake, Lindrith and Heron Lake State Park. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Avoid or delay travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for sudden loss of traction.

area.areaDesc: Cibola; McKinley; Rio Arriba; San Juan; Sandoval
